intro: Homalobus standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican starfruit, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, yellow-orange berries that are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are typically pink or white. Homalobus standleyi thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas.
